Falcata to fleet, are you reading this? The EM field fluctuations,
the ship's internal power sources. I think it's entering another
regeneration stage? Hold on, reading a power spike\..\..\..
Oh \v[313], I didn't think the Cube would activate so soon!\.\. Helm,
full evasive!\. Retarget weapons for the Cube's ma---\.\^
We've been hit!\. Our shields have failed. Phasers are offline!\.
Weapons crew dead;\. torpedo tubes jammed. EPS conduits blown on all
decks. Our warp core is destabilizing - we have a coolant leak\..\..\..\.!
All hands, abandon ship!\.\. I repeat, all hands, abando-----\.\^
The Falcata's gone!\| Helm, hard to port, don't let the debris\..\..\..\.!
Iliad to fleet, we've sustained heavy damage. Weapons are offline.
\n[30], if you can send a damage control team, that would be
much appreciated. We need to get back in the fight.
Count up turns for custom events
Launching Peregrine starfighter squadrons to cover the Cardassian
ships. Magna Carta and Arendal, join \n[30]'s flank.
Event 1: Civilians finish evac. Cardassian ships leave to help
Captain, the civilian vessels have evacuated all the colonists
they can carry, but there are still thousands on the planet. We
need more ships to evacuate all we can.
Understood, Gul. All ships, regroup to cover the Cardassian ships!
Event 1: More Cardassian ships leave to help
The Lakarian and Lang have left the system. Pulling back more of
That just leaves us and the Ithia, but there are too many colonists
remaining!\. A Galor and Keldon can't transport them all!
Damn!\.\. Simpson to Odhiambo.\. The Dalziel's only a supply ship,
fall back with the Damar and Ithia, evacuate as many as you can
Thank you, Captain. Hopefully, our final three ships can evaucate
Sorry, Captain! No such luck. We have just under two thousand
colonists remaining, but our ships are all full up, with life
Understood, Gul. The Iliad will hold off the Cube as long as we
can, then. \n[29], Arendal and Magna Carta,
That's an order, Captains! Get those colonists to safety, and good
Release the warp core safeties once the other ships are clear of
You know what I intend to do.
Chief Engineer Taurik here, sir. I understand and we will be
ready to detonate the warp core on your order.\!
I have also successfully integrated our tactical systems, we
should be able to fire more weaponry at once, Captain.
Excellent. \.And everyone else, we fight until the rest of our
fleet and the colonists are safe!\!
Iliad hit. Remaining allies leaving system
God damn it! Engineering, get on that right away!
Chief Engineer Taurik here, Captain. The last hit caused a chain
reaction in our EPS grid and has severely damaged our warp
nacelles and impulse drive. We are, effectively, immobile.
Understood. Is the warp core ready?
We are primed to create a short-delay antimatter explosion on your
order, sir. However, I must point out that our escape pods do not
have enough velocity to leave the blast radius.
If the Borg are back, we have to stop them here and now before
their ship regenerates fully and they're unstoppable. Do you have
I agree with your assessment, sir, and I am sure the crew does as
well, with the Frontier Day Crisis in recent memory. I was just
Captain Simpson, the colonists have all been successfully evacuated.
The \n[29], Magna Carta and Arendal are exiting the system at
high warp now. Now get out of there, Captain!
Excellent work, \n[30], but I'm afraid we aren't going anywhere.
Our engines are shot, and we can't let the Borg wreck havoc across
the Alpha and Beta Quadrants ever again. Get to safety,
\n[30]. Once you're at warp, the Iliad will start a
Engineering, once those ships leave,\. blow it.
